comments.body:
OO agreed to make the following updates according to the motion to accept the following:
 * Clarify that NCI Thesaurus is not necessarily used outside the US, and are aware of at least EUDAMED is used as well.  Therefore we should add EUDAMED as another potential source.  Rob will validate for right source and reference and HTA for consistency if needed.
 * Add examples from both, that include those referenced in DEV-14.  Marti will pull those used in FHIR and Hans will pull from the v2 text referencing some.

Rob Hausam, Marti Velezis  Against: 0; Abstain: 0; In Favor: 10

items.newDisplayValue:
Add the following values to http://build.fhir.org/valueset-identifier-type.html: 
- Basic UDI-DI
- Primary UDI-DI
- Secondary UDI-DI
- Direct Marking UDI-DI
- Unit of Use DI
- Reference Number

basic-UDI-DI: Basic UDI-DI - An identifier referenced in relevant certificates and declarations of conformity for the device model, in EU jurisdiction.
primary-UDI-DI: Primary UDI-DI - An identifier that is the main on the base packaging of the device and serves as the key to jurisdictional databases.
secondary-UDI-DI: Secondary UDI-DI - An identifier that is an alternate (secondary) lookup for a medical device that is issued from a different issuing agency than the primary DI.
direct-marking-UDI-DI: Direct marking UDI-DI - An identifier that is permanently marked directly on the medical device.
unit-of-use-DI: Unit of use DI - An unmarked identifier assigned to an individual medical device when a UDI is not labeled on the individual device at the level of its unit of use.
reference-number: Reference Number - A number used by a manufacturer in a catalog or item master used for ordering (also known as the stock-keeping unit (SKU) or catalogue number).

items.newDisplayValue:
Code | Display | Definition
UDI | Universal Device Identifier | An identifier assigned to a device using the Unique Device Identification framework as defined by IMDRF (http://imdrf.org). This value is deprecated and Distribution Identifier should be used instead.
DISTID | Distribution Identifier | An identifier appearing on the packaging of a marketed product used to track it through its lifecycle (e.g., transport, inventory, use, and disposal).
DIRECT-MARKING | Identifier directly marked on the identified item | An identifier physically marked on the item that it identifies.
SINGLE-ITEM | Identifier for any single item of a homogeneous collection	| An identifier pre-defined by the assigner used for identifying an individual item in a homogeneous collection. An example of use of this value is the "Unit of use DI" as defined in the regulatory medical device databases (e.g. GUDID for US and EUDAMED for EU)

comments.body: See proposed disposition of FHIR-31750.
comments.author: marti_velezis

comments.body: Does this also affect table 0203? UDI is there, but the others are not.
comments.author: FrankOemig

customFieldValues.value:
Code | Display | Definition
UDI | Universal Device Identifier | An identifier assigned to a device using the Unique Device Identification framework as defined by IMDRF (http://imdrf.org). This value is deprecated and Distribution Identifier should be used instead.
DISTID | Distribution Identifier | An identifier appearing on the packaging of a marketed product used to track it through its lifecycle (e.g., transport, inventory, use, and disposal).
DIRECT-MARKING | Identifier directly marked on the identified item | An identifier physically marked on the item that it identifies.
SINGLE-ITEM | Identifier for any single item of a homogeneous collection	| An identifier pre-defined by the assigner used for identifying an individual item in a homogeneous collection. An example of use of this value is the "Unit of use DI" as defined in the regulatory medical device databases (e.g. GUDID for US and EUDAMED for EU)

The jurisdictional databases of medical devices (GUDID in US, EUDAMED in EU) define a collection of complimentary identifiers for medical devices, that need to be recorded in FHIR resources representing devices in catalogs, in particular the DeviceDefinition resource. The primary UDI device identifier goes in a dedicated element of DeviceDefinition whereas the other complimentary identifiers fit in the DeviceDefinition.identifier element 0..*.

Each of these identifiers has its own type.

issues.summary: Make clear the subsumptions in http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0203

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue:
The code system [identifierType|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html] includes values that subsume others, but this is not documented.
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

Identify and document the subsumptions.
items.newDisplayValue:
The code system [identifierType](https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html) includes values that subsume others, but this is not documented.
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

Identify and document the subsumptions.

items.oldDisplayValue:
The code system [identifierType](https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html) includes values that subsume others, but this is not documented.
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

Identify and document the subsumptions.
items.newDisplayValue:
The code system [identifierType|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html] includes values that subsume others, but this is not documented.
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

Identify and document the subsumptions.

items.oldDisplayValue:
The code system [identifierType|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html] includes values that subsume others, but this is not documented.
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

Identify and document the subsumptions.
items.newDisplayValue:
Identify and document the subsumptions in the code system [identifierType|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html].
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

comments.body:
This is important as [Identifier.type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#identifier] is bound [extensibly|https://hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#extensible] to [IdentifierType|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html]. This means that any instance of Identifier.type using a coding outside of [IdentifierType|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html] may also need to use a coding inside of [IdentifierType|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html]. For example uses of UPIN must also use the coding PRN, and uses of LACSN must also include ACSN.

The full range of these constraints is not documented anywhere, and should be.

See Zulip [Extensible binding of Identifier.type|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179177-conformance/topic/Extensible.20binding.20of.20Identifier.2Etype/near/286992151]
comments.author: richardt

comments.body: A decision was taken about 8 years ago when the v2 tables were model-mapped to HL7 Code Systems that all v2 table values are flat, ie NO hierarchy and NO explicit subsumption.    Therefore doing what is requested in this ticket is a violation of that policy.   Any change to the decisions needs to be deliberated by the Vocabulary WG.  [~rhausam]  was there for the decision; this position was proposed and championed by Jim Case at the time.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: That makes the technical problem smaller. Consistent use of [Identifier.type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#identifier] does not need a full hierarchy, just a decision as to which members of [identifierType CodeSystem|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html] can be used alone in Identifier.type, and which need to be used together with a value from [IdentifierType ValueSet|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html],
comments.author: richardt

comments.body:
If it is decided that Identifier.type can have, for example, the coding LACSN without also having the coding ACSN, that needs to be documented clearly in the definition of [Identifier.type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#identifier] or [IdentifierType ValueSet|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html].

And guidance needs to be made about how to decide for local codes when one from [IdentifierType ValueSet|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html] is required.
comments.author: richardt

comments.body: Agree, we cannot bring this forward without major changes.
comments.author: FrankOemig

customFieldValues.value:
Identify and document the subsumptions in the code system [identifierType|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html].
Examples 
* LACSN is subsumed by ACSN and 
* UPIN is subsumed by PRN

items.newDisplayValue:
New 'Use with HL7 Standards' sub-tab page (including table) in External Code Systems
Addition of Using X External Code System with HL7 Standards pages
Addition of new Metadata and Identifier records for external code systems
Retirement of older ISO3166 Metadata and Identifier records

comments.body: TSMG voted to transfer Using External Code System with FHIR from the core FHIR specification to THO.
comments.author: reuben.daniels

comments.body:
Note TSMG (including HTA subcommittee) vote in the following minutes:

[https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TSMG/2022-08-15+TSMG+Agenda+and+Minutes|https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TSMG/2022-08-15+TSMG+Agenda+and+Minutes]
comments.author: reuben.daniels

customFieldValues.value:
New 'Use with HL7 Standards' sub-tab page (including table) in External Code Systems
Addition of Using X External Code System with HL7 Standards pages
Addition of new Metadata and Identifier records for external code systems
Retirement of older ISO3166 Metadata and Identifier records

Changes approved by the Vocabulary WG and TSMG (HTA).

Changes votes on at TSMG Meeting: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TSMG/2022-02-02+TSMG+Agenda+and+Minutes

In the Vocabulary WG main call on 28 October 2021 (minutes: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=79516234) , a proposal to Transfer the Using X (extenal code system) with FHIR pages from the FHIR core specification to HL7 Terminology (THO) was presented and voted for.

This ticket address implementation of the changes related to THO. Specifically, to:

1. Replacing the "All Content" sub-tab on the External Terminologies (note: this top page heading separately change to External Code Systems as part of a different change request) with a new "Use in HL7 Standards" sub-tab which includes the table as indicated in the proposal.

2. Add the Using X Code System with FHIR pages to THO as permanlinks.
Terminology Services Management Group / Terminology Authority

comments.body: https://bitbucket.hl7.org/projects/UTG/repos/utg/commits/6180b4ab38a28d8a30c75de92413555c2da411e6
comments.author: marc.duteau

comments.body:
Code system [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-Race]

I have a number of issues with this as it stands:
 * This proposal list the OID for the code system as 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14914, but the page in the build has the OID = 2.16.840.1.113883.5.104, Which is correct?
 * There are MANY value sets that reference the race code system and when the code system is retired, we need to likely retire all the value sets that reference it, or change them all to reference one of the two active race and ethnicity code systems. It is not clear to me that any of these sub-part value sets are used at all. 

[~marc.duteau] and [~Matt_Elrod] - can you clean this up?
comments.author: Rob_McClure
tedhl7geek

comments.body: The control manifests have been updated to show the file is in the retired list and the ticket is back in consensus review.
comments.author: marc.duteau

comments.body: [~marc.duteau] - Sorry, but have you addressed the issues Ted and I identified? Or will [~Matt_Elrod]? As this stands I will vote NEG.
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body:
This part of Ted's comment has been addressed:

"{{I do see that the v3 code system (an artifact pushlished im the v3 coremif for decades) does have its status set to 'retired', but the change to the manifests to remove it from the active v3 code systems list to the retired code systems list was not done.}}"

But I don't have the ability to fix and/or address the other issues. [~Matt_Elrod] will have to change the OID in the proposal description as well as the link in the change object field to the code system OID and link, as well as the sponsor stuff. I believe there are separate Jira tickets for tackling the value sets though either [~LisaRNelson] or [~Matt_Elrod] could speak to that.
comments.author: marc.duteau

comments.body:
Coming into the discussion late - so apologies, if this is clear to everyone else.

the codes used in this code system look like the CDCREC codes - I believe that is what happened in V2 - HL7 adopted them for use with the applicable table number. Shoudn't this code system entry point to the CDCREC code system and indicate it should be used instead?

Another question: CDCREC covers both race and ethnicity values - but this is not addressing the ethnicity code system ([https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/branches/UP-263-deprecate-the-race-code-system-in-tho/CodeSystem-v3-Ethnicity.html),] which is a subset of the CDCREC codes. 

Should THO provide valuesets for use for race and ethincity drawing from CDCREC, providing the appropriate codes for each - that can then be used across ALL HL7 product families?
comments.author: RikiM

comments.body:
The HL7 v2 come system has bee retired.    Right now there is no browsable link to CDCrec to point to; there is active work underway to address that.

 

The original HL7 Ethnicity code system was a two concept system with the code H and N.  These do not exist in CDCREC - the concepts do, but different codes.   This should probably be straightened out some day.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Note also that the changes in this proposal do not seem to address the issue of the many V3 value sets built on this code system which is being retired.   TSMG should be asked what is the governance directive when this is done to underlying code systems?   Have they made any decisions on this kind of thing [~reuben.daniels] and [~cmacumber]?
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Prior to depreciation, if approved, there should be an indication of what code system is to be used in its stead. The example shows the code system as retired not deprecated; was this intentional or an error? This code system is used in a large number of existing specifications; has any consideration been given to a migration path for them?
comments.author: AMS

comments.body: AMS, the vocab WG has not yet approved the means to deprecate a code system and show it in the THO UI.  Your points are valid and important.    This should likely not be retired if it is just deprecated.    The Deprecation task force has made some recommendations for codes, but I do not recall if they have finished their work for Code Systems.  It may require an extension to be defined for this.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Is there a recommended acknowledged source of truth code system to be used as an alternative?
comments.author: AMS

comments.body: [~AMS] CDC is the source for race and ethnicity in USA and always has been but like many things we've both made things difficult. CDC has *_one_* code system for both race and ethnicity. It is the code system [Race & Ethnicity - CDC|https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewCodeSystem.action?id=2.16.840.1.113883.6.238] is actually _officially_ found as an excel file [here|https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/DownloadHotTopicDetailFile.action?filename=29DF7191-76CC-E611-8E51-0017A477041A]     This request is because HL7 split that single code system, that has two root codes, Race and also Ethnicity, into two code systems. It is not two code systems, it is one, with a single url and a single OID.
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body:
UTG/THO subcommittee reviewed this ticket on 5/31/22. 

[~marc.duteau] to follow up with [~Matt_Elrod] to use the deprecation process outlined by the Vocab Deprecation Task Force.
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body:
[~Matt_Elrod] , [~marc.duteau] will work with you to follow the deprecation process outlined on  [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Deprecation+Policy+Framework] . [~tedhl7geek] will assist with the creation of the appropriate tabs, since we will be adding tabs for deprecated content in THO. 

Noting that there are two other tickets related to deprecating code systems:

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-264

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-265
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body: Needs revision to be in line with deprecation policy for THO.  [~marc.duteau] will handle.
comments.author: marc.duteau

comments.body: Is there a recommended acknowledged source of truth code system to be used as an alternative?
comments.author: AMS

comments.body: In eCR (http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/StructureDefinition-us-ph-tribal-affiliation-extension.html) we bind to the VALUE SET http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-TribalEntityUS which is based on the above code system. What happens to the value set we have used if the code system is deprecated. Is there another code system to use?
comments.author: minigrrl

comments.body: We do need someone with expert knowledge of how the US wants to represent Tribal entities. I presumed that the "proper" code system for this was the [CDC Race and Ethnicity code system|https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewCodeSystem.action?id=2.16.840.1.113883.6.238] (the race part.) But the codes in this older V3 tribal entity code system ([https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v3-TribalEntityUS.html)] are completely different - both codes and representational focus (the V3 has many "village of xxx") - so we need input from a representative of the US tribal community to weigh in. [~Matt_Elrod], I think that is on you.
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body: And this may be a good source for the FedReg lists of "Federally recognized tribal entities" per year: [https://narf.org/nill/triballaw/directories.html] and from brief search, the list in the federal register hits some, but not all within the Race concepts in CDCREC (Dry Creek Rancheria Band of Pomo Indians, California [previously listed as Dry Creek Rancheria of Pomo Indians of California] is not in the CDC list and I'm sure there are others.) So don't know what the best source for this is.
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body:
From [~lconn]: From discussions at CDC on USCDI we have been given information about using the most recent version (2022) of the https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/01/28/2022-01789/indian-entities-recognized-by-and-eligible-to-receive-services-from-the-united-states-bureau-of (Indian Entities Recognized by and Eligible To Receive Services From the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs).

"The following standards for the answer: Indian Entities Recognized by and Eligible To Receive Services From the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs, 87 FR 4636, 01/28/2022 (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/01/28/2022-01789/indian-entities-recognized-by-and-eligible-to-receive-services-from-the-united-states-bureau-of) with added HL7 NullFlavor values: NI (no information), OTH (other), UNK (unknown), ASKU (asked but unknown). "
comments.author: minigrrl

comments.body: [~minigrrl] You have confirmed the [FR source| https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/01/28/2022-01789/indian-entities-recognized-by-and-eligible-to-receive-services-from-the-united-states-bureau-of] for the strings, which is the same as most recent link at the nerf.org location. But we need a code system that has those strings as concepts. Where do we get that code system? Will it be in the updated CDC Race and Ethnicity code system?
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body: Due to complications with the source for this code system this ticket is returning to the proposal draft state until we know what should actually happen with this code system.
comments.author: marc.duteau

issues.summary: Add Tabs for Deprecated Content

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

comments.body: Upon cursory examination of current content, the only UI display tasks are to add a 'Deprecated' sub-tab to 'HL7 Code Systems' and 'Value Sets'.   Performing the inventory will produce the list of what needs to go into the manifests.  The desired textual paragraphs for the tab pages should be suggested in a comment here, and it will be added when the draft branch and initial content is generated.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body:
Below is the text to be added for the deprecation tabs:

HL7 CODE SYSTEMS AND VALUE SETS

Deprecation indicates that the object has been published and is retained for historical purposes, but should not be used to create new content or revise existing content.

For in-depth information about deprecation, including the process to deprecate an artifact (CodeSystem or ValueSet) or element (such as a concept), please see [link to THO documentation , new section]

Deprecation should not be confused with retirement. Deprecation provides usage guidance specifying that the object SHOULD not be used for new or revised content, whereas retirement indicates it SHALL NOT be used for new or revised content.

Deprecation is an HL7-specific process that provides users of HL7 specifications with guidance for using objects within HL7 implementations. For example, an object may be deprecated if it has been in use for some time and then gets updated or replaced, and guidance is to be provided for what to use instead. This may also be done when planning for an artifact (CodeSystem or ValueSet) to be retired in the near future.

ADD SENTENCE BELOW TO RETIRED TABS FOR HL7 CODE SYSTEM AND VALUE SETS

Retirement has been declared by the HL7 steward of the (CodeSystem or ValueSet) and indicates that the formal status of the resource is no longer active.

FOR RETIRED EXTERNAL CODE SYSTEMS

Retirement has been indicated by the HL7 community and/or the owner/publisher of the Code System and indicates that it is no longer active.
comments.author: jsnell

customFieldValues.value:
From https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Deprecation+Policy+Framework: 
Add layout support to THO (if deprecated content exists in each category that is considered in scope)
-Perform inventory of deprecated content across THO to determine what subtabs are needed (some subtabs listed below may not have any deprecated records yet)
-Deprecation should be clearly documented on all deprecation-related subtabs
-Add a subtab under HL7 Code Systems labeled "Deprecated"
--Manifest will include all deprecated HL7 code system objects
-Add a subtab under Value Sets labeled "Deprecated"
--Manifest will include all deprecated HL7 value set objects
-Add a subtab under External Code Systems labeled "Deprecated Content"
--Manifest will include all deprecated external code system metadata records
-Add a subtab under External Identifier Systems labeled "Deprecated"
--Manifest will include all deprecated external code system metadata records

comments.body: "No suggested values" seems to be erroneous...given that values are suggested.  Is this table any different than any other user-defined table for which a representative / example set of values is provided?
comments.author: mfaughn

comments.body: [~mkmcdaniel] - please add this to an agenda for an FM call and determine if the suggested values make sense or if they can be removed.
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body:
[~craig.newman],
We've looked at this and Michael is correct, not sure why the description says:
Description
Table of codes that specify the adjustment quantity. *_No suggested values._*

FM Working on add'l review.

Thanks!
comments.author: mkmcdaniel

comments.body:
6/14/2022 FMWG Notes. 

Question for V2MG:  Does the CWE have to have a qualifier? If so, this may not be correct.

1) The 0560 - Coded Content. Need to remove the values that are being displayed.
2) remove the table reference from  Chapter 16 PSL-12 Product/Service Quantity
3) Chapter 16, 16.4.6.8 ADJ-6 Adjustment Quantity
a) remove the table value displayed in the lsit
b) Remove the paragraph:
X12 REF: table 673 Quantity Qualifier. New values from X12 673 can be added as required. Refer to User-defined Table 0560 - Quantity Units in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for suggested values. 

[~craig.newman], Any suggestions for how we go forward?
THX....
comments.author: mkmcdaniel

comments.body:
[~mkmcdaniel] 

v2MG is fine with removing the example values from table 560 is that is what FM wants

For a data type like CQ where the CWE is a Component, the binding to the table of coded values must be in the field, and not in the data type because the binding may be different for different fields using CQ. So for PSL-12 and ADJ-6, it is appropriate to keep the table 560 list in the segment definition. If you think that these two fields should be using different units of measure, then there should be multiple tables (but given that for at least 560, there are no suggested having separate tables may not provide any additional value over just using 560 for both fields)
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body: Are we then reduce table 0560 to concept domain only!?
comments.author: FrankOemig

comments.body:
That would make sense. 

Note that removing the suggested values also requires editing the segment field definitions that reference table 560's suggested values.
comments.author: mfaughn

customFieldValues.value: In the v2.9 publishing database, table 560 is flagged as No Suggested values, but it has values defined and listed.  Because of the flag, it was not imported and created as a v2 code system, thus the value set triggers and error as there is nothing for it to point to.   Needs a v2 code system, and the publishing database needs to be fixed.

comments.author: richardt

comments.body: Once this ticket has enough positive votes it will be processed and implemented by the UTG content curators. Please don't make pull requests against the Bitbucket master.  Changes made there are not reflected in THO which is built off of the github repo managed by the UTG content curators and only mean that we have to revert the changes to properly reflect what is currently in the github master.
comments.author: marc.duteau

comments.body:
I'm taking issue with the proposed definition for this code and/or the proposed code.  The issue is that Advance Care Directives do not necessarily imply that "actions can be taken".  Some advance care directives simply state preferences that should be taken into consideration when someone with the needed authority to make a decision actually decides what to do or not to do.  

I am recommending a different code and/or a different definition be considered to avoid confusion.  

[~corey_spears] [~mariadmoen] [~Matt_Elrod] @stephen chu [~emmanurse] [~lheermann]

UTG/THO subcommittee reviewed the ticket on 6/14/22. 

If you do not have voter permissions (do not have options at the top of the screen to vote Affirmative or Negative), you can request them via the Consensus Review area on this page: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91993407#VocabularyMaintenanceatHL7-ConsensusReview
on 6/14/22.
comments.author: LisaRNelson

comments.body: You're misunderstanding.  This code is in R4 but is missing in THO.  It needs to be re-instated so R4 use of Consent doesn't fail
comments.author: david.pyke

comments.body: This was reviewed on the UTG/THO subcommittee call on 2022-07-12. TSMG/Vocab is investigating and determining how to fix this issue of content being in both THO and FHIR spec came to happen in the first place.
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body:
Reviewed on UTG/THO Subcommittee call on 8/9/22. General thinking on this call is that we should restore the missing code (as it was already in R4) and then deal with the definition of the code in a separate ticket. 

[~LisaRNelson], do you agree that would that be a sufficient approach?
comments.author: jsnell

customFieldValues.value: Marc Duteau, Michael Faughn, Jessica Bota

The ADR code was removed prior to the UTG migration, this migration broke Consent R4 implementation guide development which allows the adr code.  This needs to be added back with the following values

code: adr,
display: Advanced Care Directive
definition: Actions to be taken if they are no longer able to make decisions for themselves

issues.summary: Please add additional format Codes to the http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-HL7DocumentFormatCodes codeSystem

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

customFieldValues.value:
An new version of the PACP IG is being published in Sept called version 1.3 of the PACP IG. Please add the following format codes: 

urn:hl7-org:sdwg:pacp-structuredBody:1.3 For documents following PACP 1.3 constraints using a structured body.

urn:hl7-org:sdwg:pacp-nonXMLBody:1.3 For documents following PACP 1.3 constraints using a structured body.

Also note, the additional format codes should have been added to this codes system:

The format codes for PACP documents which are conformant to earlier versions of the PACP IG are:
urn:hl7-org:sdwg:pacp-structuredBody:1.2 For documents following PACP 1.2 constraints using a structured body.

urn:hl7-org:sdwg:pacp-nonXMLBody:1.2 For documents following PACP 1.2 constraints using a structured body.
urn:hl7-org:sdwg:pacp-structuredBody:1.1 For documents following PACP 1.1 constraints using a structured body.

urn:hl7-org:sdwg:pacp-nonXMLBody:1.1 For documents following PACP 1.1 constraints using a structured body.

comments.body: Why is it necessary to add unknown to this code system when a code for unknown already exists as a null flavor or missing value reason? Shouldn't the value set be modified to use these values rather than altering the code system?
comments.author: AMS

comments.body:
[~AMS]

+*Patient Care FHIR Conference Call on 2022-03-24*+

Most other FHIR "required" bindings are to FHIR-managed code systems that DO contain an unknown code, such as:  [Codesystem-request-status - FHIR v4.6.0|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-request-status.html] and [Codesystem-event-status - FHIR v4.6.0|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-event-status.html]

Because this element is a CodeableConcept with a "required" binding, it is somewhat unique that it goes through UTG review.  PC questions why we wouldn't treat this code system like other required bindings because PC doesn't think it will get reused outside of the context of FHIR Condition.clinicalStatus given how tailored this code system is to that context of use.

The alternative is to curate our value set to pull in unknown from [Codesystem-data-absent-reason - FHIR v4.6.0|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-data-absent-reason.html], but that creates a variance in pattern from other required bindings (added complexity without obvious benefit)
comments.author: michelle.m.miller

comments.body: [~michelle.m.miller] Thanks for the explanation. I now understand why adding 'Unknown' to the code system is desired. The alternative would be to modify the 'required' binding to bind to a value set instead of the code system. "*added complexity without obvious benefit*"
comments.author: AMS

comments.body:
UTG/THO subcommittee reviewed this ticket on 5/31/22. 

[~marc.duteau] to add this branch back so that the content can be rendered for review again.
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body:
I was previously concerned how this would impact the Clinical Status template in C-CDA.  but i reviewed that template and confirmed that the Clinical Statement pattern for Clinical Status of a Problem will allow the use of the null flavor of "unknown".  

Note: If the guidance wants to prohibit the use of the concept "other" that really needs to be addressed explicitly. Right now there is nothing prohibiting the use of "other".
comments.author: LisaRNelson

customFieldValues.value: Remove link to code system and value set for table 0112 in the UTG HL7 v2 Table List Summary page.

Table 0112 is a concept domain only with no example values (this is what is reported in v2.9 Chapter 2C). So there is a disconnect. If no values, then the hyperlinks can be removed in the UTG summary table (because there is CS or VS page to link to).

issues.summary: Add ICF and Resolve Issue with existing ICF Dutch Translation per HTA

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue: Adding a new code system and naming system for ICF (the international designation). Clarify that the existing ICF code system and naming system are for the Dutch translation.
items.newDisplayValue:
Adding a new code system and naming system for ICF (the international designation) and an ICF code system and naming system are for the Dutch translation. 

Note that the URI for the Dutch translation is being used to represent the international designation in the FHIR specification: http://build.fhir.org/terminologies-systems.html . It is expected that this entry will be removed from the FHIR spec prior to the R5 publication.

customFieldValues.value:

https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/International+Classification+of+Functioning%2C+Disability+and+Health+%28ICF%29+-+Dutch

comments.body:
On inspection, there appears to be one item missing from the Change Request:  this is identified as a proposal for "Unified" vocabulary and is a change to an existing ValueSet.  This ValueSet is currently part of the FHIR collection of Value Sets (on the FHIR subtab for ValueSets in THO).   The Steward of the Value Set is CBCC, but as this requested is coming from the HL7 Affiliate community, it is. of International interest as well.    The wording of the proposal implies this ValueSet is to be promoted from the FHIR suntan to the Unified subtab; if this is correct it must be noted in the proposed changes.  If not, then either the steward of the value set or FMG must weigh in on the change, if not actually endorse it.  From the name of the value set and its content, does not the Security WorkGroup also have some skin in this?

I will check for syntactical errors next.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: [~tedhl7geek] we did not intend that the ValueSet is promoted from the FHIR subtab to the Unified subtab, please apologize if we formulated this badly. we would like just that the code will be added to this ValueSet/CodeSystem. The steward of the ValueSet will weight in during this proposal or do I understand the process wrong? It is the first time we want to add a code form the hl7 swiss affiliate so thanks for your patience and feedback.

comments.body:
[~oliveregger], glad to hear it. If you look at the two tabs on this ticket, 'Voting and Quorum Summary' and 'Quorum Requirement Details', it should provide a little more insight. 

You have 10 out of the 15 require votes. Those in 'OSG' groups (listed on the right side of the ticket) have two votes per proposal so just getting a few more people to weigh in would help move this along. You can certainly tag some of those folks right here on this ticket to let them know you would like input. 

You also need to fulfil the 'unified' family requirement (this is in the 'Quorum Requirement Details' tab). This means that either [~cmacumber] or [~rhausam] need to vote. We reviewed this ticket on today's UTG call so Rob is aware of the ticket, and knowing this is still something you'd like will likely take some time to review and vote on it. 

We are working on making this process easier and more transparent, so hopefully next time the expectations are much clearer :)

comments.author: oliveregger

comments.body: My main question is, does it make sense to add codes like this (similarly with 'at-elga') to this code system and value set in the base FHIR standard?  The code system and value set are defined as "This value set includes *sample* Regulatory consent policy types from the US and other regions." (emphasis mine).  I don't think that this code system and value set were actually intended to contain the policy rule codes for all jurisdictions - just *examples* of them.  It is a bit odd that Consent.policyRule has an extensible binding to this example value set, but that could be taken up with the CBCC WG.  The IG for the Swiss EPR system (presumably there is one?), though, could include this value set and then *also* include this or any other needed codes that could be defined in the IG for that use.  I think that should also be workable?  I may still vote for this, but I would like for us to consider this broader question on it first.
comments.author: rhausam

comments.body: [~rhausam] thank you for your comments. I did not interpret this ValueSet as a "sample" due to the extensible binding on Consent.policyRule. We can put the code in our swiss implementation guide, however since most of the samples are from US origin I think it might be still add value to add a few other codes from other jurisdictions. If there would be further discussion on a call can you let me know?
comments.author: oliveregger

comments.body: I'm not certain that my interpretation or suggested solution is necessarily correct, [~oliveregger].  But, as I mentioned earlier, from what is written I think it is at least plausible.  This may represent a case where something that originally began as an example then became considerably more than that (whether that should happen is a question, but at least in some cases it has).  I agree that even if we leave this code system/value set as an example, it may be very reasonable to add a few additional codes (likely including yours) from multiple jurisdictions.  Maybe we need to arrange some discussion with CBCC to better understand what their intent (past and present) for this actually is?
comments.author: rhausam

comments.body: Yes, I think a discussion with CBCC about their intent would be helpful. They have a call on Wednesday 01:00 PM (US Eastern Time), however the call tomorrow is cancelled. [~rhausam] Would you be able to attend one of the following calls or would it be better to try to schedule the discussion for the next wgm?

customFieldValues.value: add a ch-epr code to CodeSystem/ValueSet
Paul Knapp, AbdulMalik Shakir, Rob McClure, Reuben Daniels, Joan Harper, Jessica Bota, Alexander Henket, Marc Duteau, Lisa R. Nelson

We would like to add a code to the Consent PolicyRule ValueSet and CodeSystem for our swiss epr system (ch-epr) like there is a code for the austrian epr system (at-elga). 

On 15 April 2017, the Swiss Federal Council brought the Federal Act on the Electronic Patient Record (EPRA) into force. From April 2020, hospitals and rehabilitation clinics must join a certified core community and from spring 2020, patients should be able to open an electronic patient record (EPR).

The code ch-epr will allow to characterize that a Consent PolicyRule is for the Swiss EPR and we want to use this code in our Swiss Profile on the Consent Resource (http://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7ch/ch-core/branches/epr_consent/StructureDefinition-ch-core-consent-epr.html).

http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/consent-policy
http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/consentpolicycodes

comments.body: I hesitate to return this to active status as it is:  1) not a legal code; 2) was NEVER a legal code, it is a convenience construct to avoid having to explicitly list every legal code for the individual tables (600+ of them); 3) as UTG resources are intended for use to load conformance validating server instances, adding such a code with a 'comment' intended for human readers flies just fine in a PDF document, but is IMHO bad practice in a machine-readable resource.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: [~tedhl7geek] - what is your suggestion then? Just updating the text or removing the code totally? Given that it's not a PDF anymore, should we list every valid HL7 table?
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body: For technical correctness and completeness, I suspect that each current table should have a proper legal entry (with the old ones that have been removed or withdrawn having codes there that are marked 'retired').   This might be considered overkill however, as well as being a fair amount of work to be added (we can do it programmatically, but it will take some hours to put together; it would be based on an xslt against the v2tables.xml file is easiest I would think).   I would like to hear from some of the other V2 folks who work with the v2 content and validation though.    If we do not do that, then the code indeed should be marked as 'retired' and document that it was originally in the table in error (for many years) and should never be used verbatim.   I definitely would like to hear from Conformance, but IMHO conformance checkers SHOULD throw an error if the string "HL7nnnn" (exactly that) is in any message instance.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Initial discussion from the Conformance WG available at [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CONF/2020-06-01+Conformance+Call]. The discussion will continue on the 6/9 call.
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body:
Further notes from Conformance (with Ted) are available at [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CONF/2020-06-09+Conformance+Call]

Two motions were passed:

Motion for Conformance policy: The v2 table content relative to the modern update process of UTG that the table of content is defined by the associated value set, if there is no associated value set then table of content is informed by a subset of the associated code system, if there is no associated value or associated code system then are no suggested values. *Ted/Ioana 4-0-1*

Motion on approach to HL7 396: Work item for conformance, we should create an expanded list of the equivalent concepts for table HL7 396 and add a JIRA tracker item in HL7 v2 for this issue. *Rob/Frank 5-0-0*
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body: on the 10/12/21 UTG call, we all decided that these are really waiting for input as this is coordination with the V2 management group to determine what to do about this, and with TSMG to decide what our governance and publishing of content should look like for items that for decades had syntactic shorthand for hundreds of codes that were decided to not be printed in the paper/pdf documents of vocabulary publishing of old.   This decision needs revisiting.

comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body:
Per discussion on the InM call on 12/21/2021 - [https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=81019424]

The pattern for HL7nnnn will be described as narrative data for the table and removed as an explicit value. Explicit values are proposed to be added for an HL7 defined table used in a data element with a C*E data type. These table IDs maybe found in actual instances of v2 messages. HL7 defined tables used with other data types (eg, IS, ID, MSG, etc) shouldn't have their tables included in the actual message.
comments.author: craig.newman

HL7 defined tables used with other data types (eg, IS, ID, MSG, etc) shouldn't have their tables included in the actual message.

comments.body: This is good - but...how do we explain or work around the issue that tight validation servers will kick an error when they encounter a code system identifier (third component of a v2 coded data element triplet) that hs something in it like "HL70548"?    These servers load in the values from the machine-readable THO content now.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Our major concern was that by adding several hundred HL7* codes to the table that we'd make the table much more difficult to use as there will be a lot of important value which will appear after the HL7* codes and require a lot of scrolling by users. Our goal was to keep the number of code manageable but focus on the ones that we think are the most common. If the THO teams has suggestions or requirements, we're happy to try and meet the specs you lay out. InM and the v2MG aren't the vocab experts. Perhaps we should plan on discussing at WGM?
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body:
From Vocab hosting Conformance and InM on 1/21/2022:

DECISION: Motion:

Ted motions that the concept codes defined by pattern in tables 0203 and 0396 and any other V2 code systems containing pattern-based concept codes be corrected by:
 * Identify all of the pattern-based codes in V2 code systems, then determine which will be enumerated directly in the existing code system and which will not be so enumerated - Ted will lead
 * For those that should not be enumerated directly within the existing code system, those will be enumerated in a new code system(s) using good vocabulary practices
 * All pattern-based concept codes should be made inactive and appropriately documented in the comments and notes reasons for inactivating the pattern-based concept codes
 * Modify or create the appropriate value sets that inform the table content that must include the pattern-based and now enumerated codes and adjust the links to the table code linkage accordingly in the V2 Tables code system

TK motion/ NR second: Motion carries 12-0-0

As a separate action:
 * Create a Jira ticket to track the outstanding item for current enumerated lists that are pattern-based (e.g., ICD procedures, etc. for different countries to be discussed in the future)

customFieldValues.value:
In v2.9, the code HL7nnnn in Table 0396 (codingSystem) was deprecated however this is causing confusion as readers are interpreting this to mean that the pattern cannot be used (rather than the intent to indicate that the literal string HL7nnnn cannot be used).

This code should be returned to active status with clarifying text to meet the original goal.

Proposed Display:
Health Level Seven defined table of codes, where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

Proposed Description:
Health Level Seven defined table of codes, where nnnn is any valid HL7 table number. The number is four numeric digits as published in the list of HL7 Version 2 tables. For example, HL70001.

Proposed Concept Comment:
The expression HL7nnnn is meant to restrict the value to the characters 'HL7' and four numeric digits identifying a specific table e.g. HL70001 is valid, examples of invalid values include HL71, HL701, HL7001. The literal value HL7nnnn is also invalid.

issues.summary: To make the Discharge Disposition URI resolvable

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

comments.body:
Thank you for finding this,.   It turns out that the error is in the links in v2tables code system; in v2.9, there is no HL7 table with any values fort this field, they were removed due to IP restrictions on the UB field codes brought by FM WG.   Thus this is a concept domain only. The table description reads:  "Table of codes which specify the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.). No suggested values. In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17."    This the error is that these bad links just need to be removed from the row in v2tables for table 0112.   From the v2 version 2.9 ANSI release chapter 2c, the information is:
h3. 0112 - Discharge Disposition

Concept Domain Information
|Concept Domain Name|DischargeDisposition|
|Description|The domain of possible values for the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.).  No suggested values.  In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17.|
|Concept Domain Only|yes|

 

Table Metadata
|Table|0112|
|Description|Table of codes which specify the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.).  No suggested values.  In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17.|
|Type|User|
|Steward|PA|
|where used|PV1-36|
|HL7 Version Introduced|2.1|
comments.author: tedhl7geek

issues.summary: In Table 0203 Explain the difference between SS and SB

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

comments.body:
V2 Management suggest encapsulating Lloyd's answer: Gist is that SB is a generic - it encompasses U.S. Social Security Number, Canadian Social Insurance Number and all sorts of other national (and sometimes regional) identifiers for this purpose.  SS shouldn't really exist as it's not an identifier "type" but actually refers to a specific namespace.  However, it's been used in the US for decades, so we can't exactly make it go away.  In FHIR, if you're sending a US SSN, the Identifier.type is expected to be "SB".

INM is the steward, so need to find a volunteer to update it.

issues.summary: Add a new extension to THO that allows to specify how the code system definition is incomplete

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

customFieldValues.value:
At present, the CodeSystem resource has a property called content which specifies whether the code system has no concepts, some concepts, or all concepts defined. But THO contains code system definitions that not only don't have any concepts, they don't define the filters or properties for the code system at all. They exist primarily to declare the code system's existence, it's canonical URL, and possibly copyright rules. These code system definitions trip up terminology servers, and it would be nice for the terminology servers to be able to ignore them (this has the been the source of several bugs reported in the IG publishing eco-system). 

I propose the addition of a new extension in THO which would allow the THO maintainers to mark code system definitions as to how they are incomplete. The extension should have a value type of code, and the following codes:

all : All the information about the code system is missing
filters: the filters are not specified
properties: the properties are not specified
contexts: the useContexts and jurisdictions are not specified

If the code is something other than 'all', the extension can be present multiple times. 

Note that the other properties are 0..1, so if they are missing, they're just not present. An altermative approach would be to include one of the things that are unknown with a data absent reason or nullFlavor but none of them seen particularly appropriate

issues.summary: Update FHIR Claim CareTeamRole Terminologies with codes and other details

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue:
Update the fhir claim care team role CS and VS to remove example language and add the follow codes:
attending	Attending	The attending physician.
referring	Referring	The referring physician.
operating	Operating	The operating physician.
otheroperating	Other Operating	The other operating physician.
prescribing	Prescribing provider	The prescribing provider.
purchasedservice	Purchased Service	A purchased service occurs when one provider purchases a service from another provider and then provides it to the patient, e.g. a diagnostic exam.
rendering	Rendering provider	The rendering/performing provider.

comments.body:
Reviewed on UTG/THO subcommittee call on 28 June 2022. Group suggests pulling back to draft and increment the version number as a major update (adding a new concept is a major change so it should be 1.0.0). The value set version is likely okay for now, as TSMG is still working on approving a policy for value set versioning. No other issues with the content were found. 

[~corey_spears]
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body:
Reviewed on UTG/THO subcommittee call on 28 June 2022. It appears these tickets include updates to the same resource. 

Is there any advice regarding the order that these changes be applied, or is any order acceptable? This is a use case that we knew would exist (two tickets updating the same resource), but we are encountering for the first time and want to make sure we get this right. 

Versioning, for example, is a little tricky because each ticket may update the version but when applied sequentially it may not result in the correct number without intervention from the Terminology Curator. Noting that this is something that TSMG will discuss in its Versioning Task Force that is being formed in the near future.
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body:
This table replaced HL70259 in V2.7 - here is a screenshot of the user defined values that were in HL70259 in v2.5.1 (see image-2020-06-01-20-29-52-653.png)

!image-2020-06-01-20-29-52-653.png!

We should also ask imaging about this value set. I think options would be to either re-instate this list as suggested values, or make HL70910 a concept domain, unless there is an external code system we could point to.
comments.author: RikiM

comments.body:
The equivalent table in DICOM is this one: [http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/sect_CID_33.html], which consists of two sub-tables to distinguish between Acquisition Modalities and secondary devices that also produce images.

At present, this table is the source of values for ImagingStudy.Modality ([http://build.fhir.org/imagingstudy-definitions.html#ImagingStudy.modality]).

customFieldValues.value: In the v2.9 publishing database, table 910 is NOT flagged as No Suggested values, but there are NO values defined and listed. Thus a UTG value set was created and this triggers an error as there is nothing for it to point to. Value set needs to be removed and table metadata adjusted to say No Suggested values.   The publishing database needs to be fixed, and OO should give some prose recommendations of what code system might be useful for the content

comments.body: [~tedhl7geek] Can you clarify where table 0036 is currently referenced? We don't see it in v2.9 nor on the tho site. Where is this persisting? As far as we can tell, 0036 has been removed from the v2 base specification. InM may not be responsible for making the final decision (but without more information on where 0036 may still be referenced, we don't know with WG should own the issue).
comments.author: craig.newman

comments.body: As noted in the description, it was published years ago (prior to 2.9 and I would have to do some detective work to see how long ago) but it appears in Frank's database (I can no longer run MSAccess it seems so I cannot check there myself).   It was removed, and just need to know should this just be closed and any import detritus left over should be scrubbed?  If not, then we need to figure out what needs doing.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Per Frank, this table is only in 2.1 and 2.2. Formerly used in OBR-9 (Collection Volume - which now uses the CQ data type and a different table). v2 Management Group is OK getting rid of Table 0036
comments.author: craig.newman

customFieldValues.value: This table content is not in the database, was published years ago inline in the chapter - ISO datatypes.   No longer published as of v2.9 (perhaps earlier).  Unknown if a code system with the codes needs to be created, the entry needs to be removed completely, or the table should be left and documented with No Suggested values.   INM and publishing need to weigh in.

issues.summary: Create urn:iso:std:iso:3166:-3 (Country Code Pt 3) Code System

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

customFieldValues.value: We're working on a deployment for the New Zealand Ministry of Health, which requires a valueset that expands all the codes from 3166:-1, PLUS a few of the historical codes in part 3. Ideally these would get added to base fhir package. Otherwise, our alternative would be to define our own codesystem fragment of part 3, with just those codes that are required.... however it would seem more appropriate that part 3 lived alongside parts 1 and 2 (currently available in the base ig package and github https://github.com/FHIR/packages/tree/master/packages/fhir.tx.support.r4/package).

issues.summary: Add missing value sets for cda-core-2.0

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10
Austin Kreisler, Brett Marquard, Lisa R. Nelson, Rick Geimer
Brian Pech, Frank Oemig, Robert Snelick
AbdulMalik Shakir, Austin Kreisler, Jean Duteau, Joel Francis
Grahame Grieve, Reuben Daniels, Robert Hausam

comments.body: on the 10/12/21 UTG call, we all decided that these are really waiting for input as this needs decisions from TSMG to decide what to do for publishing of content used in more than one product family where it was retired/replaced in one family but still in active current use in the other.   In other cases, items that were ConceptDomains in V3 were implemented as ValueSets for CDA; these do not, an did not exist as Value Sets in V3.   For this ticket, we need a management decision for what to do about these CDA value sets that are technically not in V3 (which is why they were not imported).
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Any news on what TSMG has decided [~tedhl7geek] ?
comments.author: seanmcilvenna

comments.body: Sean, I suspect it has fallen off the radar.   Can you follow up on this [~jsnell]?   [~cmacumber] and [~reuben.daniels] may have some background information on it as well.   It absolutely does need to be addressed, sooner rather than later.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: [~seanmcilvenna], [~tedhl7geek], thank you for following up on this. I will add this agenda item to the UTG/THO subcommittee call scheduled for tomorrow. CC: [~reuben.daniels], [~LisaRNelson]
comments.author: jsnell

comments.body:
We need the metadata that exists.  How are these referenced in CDA R2.0?  They are concept  domains, so the won't have an OID assigned in CDA.  Rob says he would need to look these up in Rosetree to check if they have OIDs there.  He could use those OIDS, but it may not be important to use those OIDS. It may be ok to just create OIDs for these.  For DocumentType, you may not find this.  At the CDA R2.0 level, it is a concept domain, so you would need to create a value set for this.  You should have the C-CDA LOINC Document Ontology as the minimum and an example binding.  

How will we approach this? Rob will look in Rosetree to see if there are OIDs to use those when creating these in THO.  Bind as an example value set when used since these were Concept Domain. If Rob can't find an OID, then he will make one up.
The RIM should have references for these Concept Domains - we would want to use RIM 2.07 because that is what CDA R2.0 was frozen to.  Back then, they still hadn't sorted out the distinction between Concept Domain, Code System, and Value Set.  
You may run into x_whatever things.... 
It may be difficult to determine what concepts actually belong in the value sets.
We may need to create a Code System
DocumentType is an abstract code under actCode.

Austin found some clues Normative Web addition of CDA .
Austin will help dig up more clues on this.
comments.author: LisaRNelson

comments.body:
In general, the CDA R2 specification was built on RIM 2.07, where the distinction between codesystem, valueset and concept domain had not been clarified, they were all called vocabulary domains. To be able to start publishing CDA IGs built on CDA R2 using FHIR Publishing, these will all need to be represented as value sets even though most are effectively concept domains as they became to be known in subsequent versions of the RIM. The first item, ActClassOrganizer clearly can be represented as valueset with a set of codes.
h2. http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ActClassOrganizer

A valueset for ActClassOrganizer should have the following values, all drawn from ActClass, and all children of ActClassOrganizer in RIM 2.07:

ORGANIZER, CATEGORY, DOCBODY, DOCSECT, TOPIC, FOLDER

Austins Notes: As far as I can tell, the base CDA R2 standard does *not* use this concept domain. CDA uses the following: x_ActClassDocumentEntryOrganizer. ActClassOrganizer does appear in the voc.xsd which is one of the core xml schemas that CDA (and any V3 specification) uses. I suspect that is how it has been pulled into CDA R2, even though its not actually used in the specification.
h2. http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-DocumentType

In RIM 2.07, DocumentType is found in the ActCode hierarchy where it is an abstract term.

Lvl          Type, Domain name and/or Mnemonic code        Concept ID          Mnemonic           Print Name    Definition/Description

1             A: ExternallyDefinedActCodes      V16493                              

*2               A: DocumentType         V10870                The kind of document. Possible values: discharge summary, progress note, Oncology note, etc.*

Austins Note: This was effectively a concept domain, except that at the time, in RIM 2.07, concept domains did not exist. The A in *A: DocumentType* indicates its an Abstract term.
h2. http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-EncounterDischargeDisposition

From the RIM v2.07 definition of EncounterDischargeDispostion vocabulary domain:

EncounterDischargeDisposition    

A code indicating patient status as of the ending service date of the period covered on this bill, as reported in FL6, Statement Covers Period. Values such as: Discharged to home or self care; Discharged/transferred to SNF, Discharged/transferred to an intermediate care facility (ICF); Expired; Hospice-medical facility. NUBC Form Locator 22

Austin's Note: RIM 2.07 did not have any values defined for EncounterDischargeDisposition. It was effectively a concept domain.
h2. http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-DrugEntity

Austins Comment: DrugEntity is an abstract term in the V3 entityCode codesystem drawn from RIM 2.07. It has three additional abstract terms as specializations. This is effectively a concept domain.

2               A: DrugEntity    V16530                A substance whose therapeutic effect is produced by chemical action within the body.

3                 A: ClinicalDrug              V16205                Any substance or mixture of substances manufactured, sold or represented for use in: (a) the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder, abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, in human beings or animals; (b) restoring, correcting or modifying organic functions in human beings or animals.

4                   A: ManufacturedDrug              V16206                Identifies a drug or the use of a drug as produced by a specific manufacturer

5                     A: PackagedDrugProductEntity           V19626                A drug product identified at the level of the package in which it is commonly distributed.
h2. http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ManufacturerModelName

From the RIM v2.07 definition of ManufacturerModelName vocabulary domain:

ManufacturerModelName    

Provides coded names for attribute Device.manufacturerModelName, which has data type SC.

Austin's Note: RIM 2.07 did not have any values defined for ManufacturerModelName. It was effectively a concept domain.
comments.author: Austin_Kreisler

comments.body:
For this one: http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ActClassOrganizer

Note name change will be http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ActClassOrganizerRIM2-07

ORGANIZER, CATEGORY, DOCBODY, DOCSECT, TOPIC, FOLDER - Updated list as of 3/10...drop FOLDER and add ORGANIZER and its children.

Name changes for the others:
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-DocumentTypeExample
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-EncounterDischargeDispositionExample
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-DrugEntityExample
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ManufacturerModelNameExample

New CodeSystem: ManufacturerModelNameExample

All of these will be bound as example bindings.

SDWG will log a Github issue to record that the CDA-core-2.0 FHIR Logical Model changes need to be made after the vocab changes are made.
comments.author: LisaRNelson

customFieldValues.value:
The "cda-core-2.0" implementation guide makes references to multiple V3 value sets and code systems that do not exist on UTG. These value sets and code systems should be added so that the "cda-core-2.0" implementation guide can be complete. Some of the missing value sets are:
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ActClassOrganizer
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-DocumentType
* http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-EncounterDischargeDisposition

issues.summary: designation use value needed for UTG to represent HL7 V2 and V3 concepts
issues.description: Designation Use code for value set bound extensible in CodeSystem.concept.designation.use needs to have the code preferredForLanguage which is in the UTG HL7 intrastructure code system [https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-hl7TermMaintInfra.html].   This is used widely in v2 and v3 imported code systems for support of the foreign language translations needed for German that we publish, see V2 code system [https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-PHRaceAndEthnicityCDC.html] and many others.  This triggers many errors in the build.   Note that the codes 'consumer' (FHIR tracker #19960) and 'display' in this value set must be there.  'consumer' is in the maintenance infrastructure vocabulary code system.   'display' (FHIR tracker #14302) is also waiting to be done and the lack of it is causing many hundreds of errors in the UTG build.
