comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: Seems to have erroneously imported from the FHIR project to the UTG project to the incorrect State.  Should all be in Waiting For Input state.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body:
I'm not sure what is happening with this?  I want to apply the resolution for FHIR-19960 and also address FHIR-14302 (which is marked as waiting for input from Grahame). 

To do that properly, I think, will require:

(1) adding the additional codes for 'preferredForLanguage' and 'consumer' (or should we use 'preferred-for-language' and 'consumer-friendly'?) to the current [designation-usage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-designation-usage.html] code system in UTG

(2) updating the UTG [designation-usage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-designation-usage.html] value set to include the 2 SNOMED CT codes
|*Code*|*Display*|
|[900000000000003001  !http://build.fhir.org/external.png!|http://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=900000000000003001]|Fully specified name|
|[900000000000013009  !http://build.fhir.org/external.png!|http://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=900000000000013009]|Synonym (core metadata concept)|

that are the contents currently of the [designation-use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] value set in the core FHIR spec

(3) update the bindings in the FHIR core spec in [CodeSystem.concept.designation.use|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-definitions.html#CodeSystem.concept.designation.use] and [ValueSet.compose.include.concept.designation.use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-definitions.html#ValueSet.compose.include.concept.designation.use] to refer to the UTG [designation-usage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-designation-usage.html] value set (instead of the FHIR core [designation-use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] value set) (note that both resources are normative)
comments.author: rhausam

comments.body: We should also look at and consider the proposal and questions in the SNOMED on FHIR project work on the [designation extension|https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/FHIR/Designation+extension].  It seems unclear if or how this extension could be used with other code systems, but it appears likely much more useful for SNOMED CT than the extended value set approach.  Are both approaches needed?
comments.author: rhausam

comments.body:
Restating my comments from [Zulip|[CodeSystem vs Valueset Disignation use[age|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179202-terminology/topic/CodeSystem.20vs.20Valueset.20Disignation.20use.5Bage.5D]]:

Seems we've twisted something simple into quite a knot. We discussed this at connectathon I believe. While I can not find any notes for the breakout on Designations, I seem to remember that there were a number of folks that shared @Grahame Grieve concern that [DesignationUse|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] was specific to SNOMED CT code system use _exclusively_ and that we need more designation "types" in what we should be using everywhere: [DesignationUsage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-designation-usage.html]. There does seem to be two UTG JIRA issues: 102 and 107 but lets follow @Rob Hausam advice and comment on 107. 

So I think we need to determine if we can remove the [DesignationUse|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] value set, and if not, then make it only apply to SCT. I think we need to add additional concepts to Code System [DesignationUsage|[http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-designation-usage.html]] but at least display, synonym, and any others requested.
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body:
I think we should:

* keep the value set
* document that the snomed codes are appropriate only for snomed ct concepts
* add our own additional codes in our code system
* add "preferred for language" and "consumer" to the UTG code system
* improve the definition of display in the existing code (What is it not?)
comments.author: GrahameGrieve

comments.body:
So, for "keep the value set", there are 2 options that I see:
 * Keep the [designation-use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] value set definition as it is:
 ** In this case the 2 SNOMED CT codes for "Synonym" and "Fully specified name" will remain as the only content in the value set.
 ** The only change to the FHIR specification is to clarify that the SNOMED CT codes are only expected to be used *with* SNOMED CT, and not with other code systems (although presumably it would not be *prohibited* to use them with other code systems).
 ** Even though it's only a change in the text, I think that change would be "*Compatible, substantive*" because, with the extensible binding, where previously many (if not most or all of us) have interpreted the SNOMED CT code as the only option available for expressing the meaning of "synonym", now it will be possible to use any code (including local or non-SNOMED codes) to represent the meaning of "synonym", at least if the code system that is being used is *not* SNOMED CT. 
 ** We would add the `preferred for language` and `consumer` codes to "our code system" (i.e. [designation-usage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-designation-usage.html] in UTG) so they would be available for use in [CodeSystem.concept.designation.use|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-definitions.html#CodeSystem.concept.designation.use] and 
[ValueSet.compose.include.concept.designation.use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-definitions.html#ValueSet.compose.include.concept.designation.use].  
*But*, this would mean that beyond "Synonym" and "Fully specified name" for use with SNOMED CT, we would be providing *no guidance* for what other codes might be used in the 'designation.use' elements - *any* code (standard or local or otherwise) could be used to specify the designation use and the instance would be conformant.

 *  Update the [designation-use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] value set definition:
 ** In this case the value set definition would be updated to also include the codes in [designation-usage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-designation-usage.html].  So this would include the codes that are in that code system now (i.e. only `display`) and any others that we add in the future (e.g., `preferred for language`, `consumer`, etc.).
 ** With the extensible binding, I believe this would be a "*Non-compatible*" change.  For example, someone may have been using a designation use code from their own code system to indicate a "consumer friendly" term, which was a conformant use.  But now they would find that, with the extensible binding, the code that they had previously been using is, in fact, no longer conformant (if someone bothered to check it).
 ** A couple of side effects (which may not be at all significant) of this are that there would be no use (as far as I'm aware) for the UTG [designation-usage|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-designation-usage.html] value set.  Plus the [designation-use|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] value set that is defined in the FHIR core spec, which is the one that we are using, is based in part on codes that are being defined in UTG (not in the FHIR spec itself or an external code system).
comments.author: rhausam

comments.body:
Documenting that the SNOMED codes are only for SNOMED seems pretty revisionist.  Also, with respect to at least 900000000000013009 (Synonym), somewhat hairsplitting and change for change's sake.

What is the difference between "preferred for language" and "display"?

What  does "consumer" mean?

Whatever changes are made to the set, it needs to be clear which values (e.g., "display" in conjunction with language) have an impact on terminology server behaviour, and which are merely for "pass-through".
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body: SNOMED "Language" reference sets ([https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/x/L4e2AQ)] are about specifying a notion of Acceptability which can vary depending on context (the specific reference set implicitly indicates the context).
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body:
The designation-use code system and value set updates issue was brought up again on the Vocab co-chairs call today.  I think we still need to answer the questions raised above (beginning with my comment on 2020-09-25 12:45) to determine explicitly and exactly what the needed changes are that will be applied so we can move this forward to completion. [~tedhl7geek] [~GrahameGrieve] [~mjlawley] [~Rob_McClure] [~cmacumber] [~carmela_couderc] [~reuben.daniels] 

We can move the discussion back to [Zulip|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179202-terminology/topic/CodeSystem.20vs.20Valueset.20Disignation.20use.5Bage.5D] or one of the FHIR core trackers (FHIR-14302 is still open) if we think that would be useful - or we can continue it here.
comments.author: rhausam

comments.body:
There is work done by the SNOMED on FHIR Terminology Services work group to develop an extension to represent three aspects of the designation used by SNOMED but also similarly in other terminologies. The three designation (description) aspects that SNOMED distinguishes are:
 * The designation type (FSN, synonym, or textual definition)
 * The designation use context (language dialects, domain specific use contexts such as consumer-friendly, nursing, medical specialty specific terms, etc.)
 * The role of the designation in that context, for SNOMED whether the designation is preferred or acceptable in that use context (i.e. acceptability). "preferredForLanguage" seems to fall in this category.

Other code systems make use of at least some of these aspects; LOINC has fully specified, short, long common, and consumer names, ICD-10 has different kinds of rubric etc. 

As you all know there is only one designation.use element to cover these three aspects, and a SNOMED CT subset for designation type, debatably the least useful use aspect, was chosen. The work done by the SNOMED on FHIR group (documented [here|https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/FHIR/Mechanisms+for+working+with+Languages]) has led to a proposal for an extension [here|https://github.com/IHTSDO/snomed-ig/blob/duc/fsh/fsh-source/DesignationUseContextExtension.fsh] for discussion.

However, if there is an opportunity to change the current binding to allow designation.use to represent the designation use context instead of designation type and hence replace the value set with a set of designation use contexts for commonly used code systems, that would be the preferred option.
comments.author: daniel.karlsson@socialstyrelsen.se

comments.body: Goodness we can make things complicated. I think we need to consider making the cardinality of xx.concept.designation.use 0..* and then allow something to identified with "types, use context, and role." Yes that means you'd need special concatenated terms where something might apply to multiple things but I challenge anyone to give me multiple real examples where this is true. This would obviously be a r5 change and we need to follow can-we-break-it rules.
comments.author: Rob_McClure

comments.body:
"as simple as possible, but no simpler"

Challenge accepted: the multiple real examples are in the text above: SYN and FSN (already in the value set), "preferredForLanguage" and "consumer-friendly" could well appear at the same time. And SNOMED CT does describe these aspects all of the time for all descriptions/designations.
comments.author: daniel.karlsson@socialstyrelsen.se

comments.body: As noted above, the semantics of "preferredForLanguage" are covered with designation.use value of "display"  why do we need to add a new code carries the same semantics?
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body: Michael, I do not see or find a designation_use value of "display" and as far as I know it is not used.    Can you point me to where it might have been defined?
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: the final state of the content of the value set needs to be the two existing SNOMED CT codes, plus the addition of the two code values [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/hl7TermMaintInfra#preferredForLanguage] and [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/hl7TermMaintInfra#consumer|http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/hl7TermMaintInfra#preferredForLanguage]
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body:
Sorry,

as the cardinality is 0..1 and binding is extensible, having all codes in the same valueset would prohibit any possibility of having a consumer preferred synonym. Further, the extension we've been working on which lets the code system provide additional information about context of use, description type, and acceptability would also break. Understanding the urgency of a solution, we're (as in the community developing the extension) happy to discuss solutions to all our needs, but please do not rush a solution with such consequences.
comments.author: daniel.karlsson@socialstyrelsen.se

comments.body:
The context comes from this ticket  FHIR-14302 

It is used in the spec itself right here [https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/languages.html##term]
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body: Hi [~daniel.karlsson@socialstyrelsen.se]  - Vocab discussed your comment and agree it is a valid comment. Please enter a separate Jira item to address the cardinality issue.
comments.author: carmela_couderc

comments.body: Vocab identified this ticket as an R4B candidate.  https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Priority+vocabulary+changes+in+FHIR
comments.author: carmela_couderc

comments.body:
Hi [~carmela_couderc],

Created (my first) ticket https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-155

Anything else that needs to be done?
comments.author: daniel.karlsson@socialstyrelsen.se

comments.body:
Hi [~tedhl7geek],

During discussion on today's SNOMED on FHIR call we dug into the {{display}} vs {{preferredForLanguage}} topic.

It seems that sometime after the 1st ballot for R4 ([http://hl7.org/fhir/2018May/languages.html##term]) the CodeSystem defining display was erroneously moved from [http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/designation-usage] to [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/designation-usage] .

I say erroneously because the semantics of {{display}} are intrinsic to the behaviour of FHIR Terminology Services (ie selection of preferred term for a given language, e.g., in the presence of the display-language parameter to ValueSet/$expand) and thus should live in the core FHIR Spec.  However, I suspect it's not a particularly useful thing to re-re-name this CodeSystem just for the sake of purity so I would suggest we're stuck with the current URI even though it should be "owned" by the FHIR spec itself.

Now, unless the intent is for {{preferredForLanguage}} to be a purely client-side indicator, it would seem to duplicate (and post-date) the semantics of {{display}} and thus it should be dropped in preference to {{display}}.

I would also argue that making it a client-side indicator is against the spirit of FHIR Terminology Services which is to offload work to the server and make the client's life simpler.
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body:
it wasn't moved erroneously - it was moved correctly. But moving it shouldn't be taken to mean that servers aren't expected to care about it - of course they must. that's why the value set is extensible - it's reasonable for servers to know the codes in the value set itself. 

{{preferredForLanguage}} doesn't a duplication of 'display'. it's full name might be '{{preferredDisplayForLanguage}} ' - it is a display, yes, but it's additionally preferred for the language (though the meaning of that is most definitely slippery)
comments.author: GrahameGrieve

comments.body:
Discussed on the 12/3/2020 FHIR Tracker call.

Discussion: preferredForLanguage and display do not have the same meaning; both should be in the value set. 

The SNOMED on FHIR work on designation use extension should continue (to capture qualifications on designation use - acceptability), and be considered for a standard extension to make it available for general use. Defining as a standard extension would be beneficial for clients. 

Peter Jordan suggests that a decision tree be created to help determine whether an extension is required. 

This ticket can move ahead independent of the SNOMED on FHIR decision.
comments.author: carmela_couderc
mjlawley

comments.body: For the record, can we have a clear explanation of how preferredForLanguage and display are different (as used in my above example https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-107?focusedCommentId=180345&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-180345)
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body:
bump :) still waiting for clarification on the semantic differences between preferredForLanguage and display.

[~tedhl7geek]?

Progress on an approach for handling of "language reference sets" in the SNOMED on FHIR group is reaching a point where we need to resolve this issue.
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body: Also noting here that [http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-definitions.html#CodeSystem.concept.designation] has text in the Comment that indicates the existence of an additional code, "primary code", albeit without a specified CodeSystem.
comments.author: mjlawley

comments.body:
Dear All,

in trying to guide our Swedish FHIR users we would like some more clarity on the difference between "display" and "preferredForLanguage". Further, as the representation of SNOMED CT output (e.g. expansion) likely will require an extension, guidance on the priority between existing codes (SYN+FSN), "consumer", "display", and "preferredForLanguage" is needed when multiple codes can be used. E.g. how should designation.use be coded for a preferred, consumer, synonym used as display? Are multiple designations required?

Thanks,
Daniel
comments.author: daniel.karlsson@socialstyrelsen.se

comments.body: The SNOMED on FHIR group discussed this ticket today and expressed a mild preference for "preferredForLanguage", and that if this was added to [http://build.fhir.org/valueset-designation-use.html] , then "display" would not be required as an additional value.
comments.author: pgwilliams

customFieldValues.value: https://terminology.hl7.org/external_terminologies.html is where users go to find information on external terminologies. But it is difficult or impossible to find code systems one is looking for by scanning the list of acronyms. Case in point: I was looking for American Joint Commission on Cancer, and couldn't find it. I finally determined the acronym is "TNM", even though AJCC defines much more than TNM-style cancer staging). I recommend spelling out the name as completely as possible to help people find what they are looking for.

items.oldDisplayValue:
The SMART Health Card Vaccination and Testing Implementation Guide (SHC - VT IG) uses several new value sets to identify the type of COVID-19 Vaccination that an individual received and COVID-19 test results:

 VaccineCVX: codes from hl7.org/fhir/sid/cvx
 VaccineGTIN: codes from gs1.org/gtin
 VaccineSNOMED: vaccine codes from SNOMED that are decedents of Vaccine product
 VaccineICD11: Values that denote whether the type of COVID-19 vaccine using ICD11 (inactivated virus, live attenuated virus, non-replicating viral vector, etc.)
 VaccineATC: ATC vaccine codes from the WHO
 QualitativeLabResultsLOINC: Lab results from LOINC codes for COVID-19 test results
 LabResultFindingsSNOMED: Lab results from SNOMED codes for COVID-19 test results
 LabResultFindings: codes for COVID-19 lab test results, using both SNOMED and LOINC value sets
 QualitativeLabResultsFindings: codes for COVID-19 test results, using both SNOMED VSAC and LOINC values
 IdentityAssuranceLevelCodeSystem: identify assurance level codes

items.newDisplayValue:
The SMART Health Card Vaccination and Testing Implementation Guide (SHC - VT IG) uses several new value sets to identify the type of COVID-19 Vaccination that an individual received or COVID-19 test results:

 VaccineCVX: codes from hl7.org/fhir/sid/cvx
 VaccineSNOMED: vaccine codes from SNOMED that are decedents of Vaccine product
 VaccineICD11: Values that denote whether the type of COVID-19 vaccine using ICD11 (inactivated virus, live attenuated virus, non-replicating viral vector, etc.)
 QualitativeLabResultsLOINC: Lab results from LOINC codes for COVID-19 test results
 LabResultFindingsSNOMED: Lab results from SNOMED codes for COVID-19 test results
 LabResultFindings: codes for COVID-19 lab test results, using both SNOMED and LOINC value sets
 QualitativeLabResultsFindings: codes for COVID-19 test results, using both SNOMED VSAC and LOINC values
 IdentityAssuranceLevelCodeSystem: identify assurance level codes

The SMART Health Card Vaccination and Testing Implementation Guide (SHC - VT IG) uses several new value sets to identify the type of COVID-19 Vaccination that an individual received or COVID-19 test results:

 VaccineCVX: codes from hl7.org/fhir/sid/cvx
 VaccineSNOMED: vaccine codes from SNOMED that are decedents of Vaccine product
 VaccineICD11: Values that denote whether the type of COVID-19 vaccine using ICD11 (inactivated virus, live attenuated virus, non-replicating viral vector, etc.)
 QualitativeLabResultsLOINC: Lab results from LOINC codes for COVID-19 test results
 LabResultFindingsSNOMED: Lab results from SNOMED codes for COVID-19 test results
 LabResultFindings: codes for COVID-19 lab test results, using both SNOMED and LOINC value sets
 QualitativeLabResultsFindings: codes for COVID-19 test results, using both SNOMED VSAC and LOINC values
 IdentityAssuranceLevelCodeSystem: identify assurance level codes

issues.summary: Add pharma, rxmail, provider, virtual to contactentity-type

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10
We were unable to find codes to communicate the various contact types that are commonly found on physical insurance cards.

comments.body: Hey, we have a need add a few tickets similar to this one. Please let us know if there is feedback on formatting before we proceed.
comments.author: jdjkelly

customFieldValues.value:
In developing an implementation guide (C4DIC) to represent all of the data elements found on a physical insurance card, we became aware there is a need for expanding this ValueSet to include additional concepts:

(code, display, description)
* PHARMA, Pharmacist Inquiries, Pharmacist Inquiries related to insurance claims/adjudication/payment
* RXMAIL, Mail Order Pharmacy, Mail order pharmacy contact information for patients
* PROVIDER, Provider Inquiries, Contact details for provider inquiries related to insurance claims/adjudication/payment
* VIRTUAL, Virtual Care, Virtual Care contact information for patients
We were unable to find codes to communicate the various contact types that are commonly found on physical insurance cards.

comments.author: tedhl7geek

customFieldValues.value: To comply with existing jurisdictional regulations, the SHC - VT Implementation Guide requires a Value Set that identifies the level of supervision during a specimen collection. Some regions or organizations will not accept test results from self-administered, at-home tests while others allow it. Without a value set to identify the collection supervision, any individual's test results in their SHC may be invalid in a jurisdiction with stricter standards for testing supervision.

issues.summary: Update to Race valueSet in THO

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

customFieldValues.value:
In the current publication of THO, 2.1.0, the valueSet Race with the Defining URL of http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-Race and OID: 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14914 has the following content logical definition:

"This value set includes codes based on the following rules:
	Include these codes as defined in http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-Race
Code	Display	Definition
2131-1
Other Race	Note that this term remains in the table for completeness, even though within HL7, the notion of Other code is deprecated.
	Import all the codes that are contained in http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-RaceNativeAmerican
	Import all the codes that are contained in http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-RaceAsian
	Import all the codes that are contained in http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-RaceBlackOrAfricanAmerican
	Import all the codes that are contained in http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-RaceHawaiianOrPacificIsland
	Import all the codes that are contained in http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-RaceWhite"
 
The correct content logical definition should be as follows:
"This values set include codes based on the following rules:
	Include these codes as defined by Race & Ethnicity  CDC codeSystem (OID 2.16.840.1.113883.6.238) where concept is-a 1000-9 (Race), but exclude 1000-9.
	Exclude other race 2121-1"

value: Realm Specific Vocabulary (US Realm for now)

issues.summary: Need Code for Direct Secure Messaging

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

comments.body:
[~LisaRNelson] This may be duplicate of UP-124 (https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-124) that has been in the queue since October.  That terminology is owned by InM and I'm hoping that we can get approval this Thursday so it can move forward.

UP-124 aims to change Table 0202 rather than Table 0201.  Table 0201 can remain the same if we update Table 0202.
comments.author: hbuitendijk

comments.body:
This topic was discussed in InM on February 25 ([https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97482379)]. 

Considering the dependency of XDM on XTN.3 to be "internet" that would be in play in the same use case, there was agreement that UP-162, adding DSM (Direct Secure Messaging) to table 0201 used in XTN.2 would be more appropriate.

Motion: Approve the content of UP-162 to add 'DSM' to table 0201; clarify when to use internet/net in XTN.3

based on IHE usage of internet and close UP-124 since it addresses .

the same need. [Hans Buitendijk|https://confluence.hl7.org/display/~hbuitendijk]/  [Nick Radov|https://confluence.hl7.org/display/~nradov].  13/2/0

 

Depending on whether it is easier to progress UP-124 through the process (it is further along) than UP-162 we will proceed.
Reply
comments.author: hbuitendijk

comments.body: [~LisaRNelson]: We got everything working on UP-124, so this one can be closed out and just point to UP-124.  Thank you!
comments.author: hbuitendijk

comments.body: The linked ticket was implemented March 30, 2021 and appears to implement the request, so this is likely no longer needed.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: [~LisaRNelson], it seems that this has been resolved in UP-124. Please confirm and close out this ticket by clicking "Draft a Proposal" in the top bar. You should then see an option to Abandon or Withdraw this ticket. Thank you!
comments.author: jsnell

customFieldValues.value:
http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0201

The HL7 0201 value set needs an additional concept that is more specific than Network. We specifically need DirectTrust Network to be added.  Direct is a special type of secure messaging which supports endpoints that are also usable as telecom addresses on the DirectTrust Network.

My ask is to have the concept DSM added to the HL7 0201 table.  It also needs to be added to Telecom Use Value Set in VSAC which means it needs to be added to the HL7 Address Use Code System.

In FHIR, this very same data element is bound to the value set called ContactPointUse.  So the code DTNet (concept DirectTrust Network) also needs to be added to contact-point-use code system: http://hl7.org/fhir/contact-point-use

Finally, we need to update these maps that make this complexity digestible.
http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/contact-point-use

issues.summary: Create THO User Interface structure to hold Identifier Systems

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue: As agreed by the Vocabulary Cochairs and a FHIR-I chair, THO should eventually be the home for a browsable page of Identifier Systems.   The first step in accomplishing this is to create the framework in THO for the tabs and documentation to hold these in a useful way.    This proposal is to begin this first step by creating the tabs, sub-tabs, and documentation paragraphs to hold this content when it is move from the existing FHIR pages, and migrated/remapped from the V3 and V2 CodeSystem entries which were imported from the old modeling of identifier systems in those Standards Families.

issues.summary: External Terminologies Text updates

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

customFieldValues.value:
All suggested changes related to the External Terminologies Tab or sub-tabs
1. Change this label in the black bar to External Code Systems (all related material refers to External Code Systems, not external terminologies)
2. Sub-tab label "Code System Identification" has a title (3.2 Code System Technical Identifiers" - suggest changing this title to 3.2 Code System Identifiers (note the change from identification to identifiers)
3. On both the Code System Technical Identifiers and Code System Metadata Records there is this text "... for External code systems published in the HL7 Terminology pages ...". Change to "...for external code systems published in terminology.hl7.org (THO).  (discussed at 9/21 WGM)
4. Code System Identification sub-tab has an explanation of what it means to be HTA curated and other, that same information should be repeated on the Code System Metadata sub-tab
5. Code System Fragments sub-tab has a note "Please see the associated HTA page for the code system for more information" - this would benefit from having a link to help folks understand where to go.
6. Back to #4 - current text doesn't explain why its important or the impact of HTA curation. Suggest adding "The Code Systems in this list are referenced in active or retired HL7 specifications and HTA manages the relationship with the Code System owners." 
7. Complete Code Systems sub-tab - suggest renaming "Code System Content Copy" (understanding why we're not using "Convenience Copy")
8. Take a run through and check capitalization External Code System, External code system, external code system, etc.

issues.summary: Define extension for v2 extensible grammar codes

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10
This issue has to be started together with UP-243

items.oldDisplayValue: This issue has to be started together with UP-243

comments.body: Brilliant idea (I assume we will soon have IG publisher support for it then? :)  )  For completeness, this one will need the different value sets defined as part of it for all of the identified offending code systems.   I absolutely support this being done..
comments.author: tedhl7geek

comments.body: While this could work for the IG publisher, it would also need to work in other actual application layer stacks. Needless to say, the Java reference implementation (HAPI) uses the same logic, but this sort of new logic imposes more work on other stacks, such as the .NET and Go stack.
comments.author: jkiddo

comments.body: [~GrahameGrieve] are you willing to take that hit?
comments.author: jkiddo

customFieldValues.value:
There's a few v2 codes that are actuall factory codes - they specify a set of codes. Here's my known list:

#0354
 RTB_Knn : Message structure
 QBP_Qnn : Message structure

#0396
 IBTnnnn: ISBT 128 codes where nnnn  specifies a specific table within ISBT 128
 HL7nnnn: Health Level Seven defined table of codes, where nnnn is the HL7 table number
 ISOnnnn: ISO Defined Codes where nnnn is the ISO table number.
 X12Dennnn: value="ASC X12 Code List nnnn

#0203
 NNxxx: National Person Identifier where the xxx is the ISO table 3166 3-character (alphabetic) country code

In all cases, a suffix 'nnn' etc is replaced by a code taken from another value set. This is creating operational difficulties because the validator doesn't know about these codes. I would like to add the following extension to the definitions of those codes:

<extension url="http://terminology.hl7.org/StructureDefinition/v2-factory-code">
  <extension url="suffix">
    <valueString value="nnnn"/>
  </extension>
  <extension url="valueSet">
    <valueCanonical value="http://terminology.hl7.org/VaueSet/iso-country-codes"/>
  </extension>
</extension>

(details vary per code, but the pattern is the same for all of them). The validator (and even any publisher) would see the extension and act accordingly

Note that there's a related change proposal for this: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-243. That fixes *one* of the codes. this proposal is an alternative solution that can work for all of the codes, and should be done for this code as a stop gap even if the other change proposal is accepted later

issues.summary: Update THO for MVX

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue: We are updating the THO page to align with the HTA page and request the changes in the attached document. Image is of current page and the content in yellow boxes are the changes requested.
items.newDisplayValue:
We are updating the THO page to align with the HTA page and request the following changes:
CodeSystem Name: Manufacturers of Vaccines (MVX)
Publisher: CDC, National Centers for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases, Immunization Information System Support Branch  Informatics

OID: 2.16.840.1.113883.12.292

Definition: 
Definition: The CDC's National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases (NCIRD) developed and maintains HL7 Table 0227, Manufacturers of Vaccines (MVX). It includes both active and inactive manufacturers of vaccines in the US. Inactive MVX codes allow transmission of historical immunization records. When MVX code is paired with a CVX (vaccine administered) code, the specific trade named vaccine may be indicated. 
Status indicates if the manufacturer is currently making vaccine for distribution in the United States.
Last Updated indicates the last time this particular manufacturer code was updated in this table.
Questions regarding MVX should be directed to the IIS Technical Assistance Team (mailto: iisinfo@cdc.gov) (or use mailing address)."

It includes both active and inactive manufacturers of vaccines in the US. Inactive MVX codes allow transmission of historical immunization records. When MVX code is paired with a CVX (vaccine administered) code, the specific trade named vaccine may be indicated. 
Status indicates if the manufacturer is currently making vaccine for distribution in the United States.
Last Updated indicates the last time this particular manufacturer code was updated in this table.
Questions regarding MVX should be directed to the IIS Technical Assistance Team (mailto: iisinfo@cdc.gov) (or use mailing address)."

issues.summary: Create new CodeSystem of "level of assurance"

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue:
We would like to create {{http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa}} to identify "level of assurance", which are codes representing identity assurance level, based on NIST 800-63-3.

[These are the specific codes that should be in this system|http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html].

There are other [LOA codes already a part of UTG|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236489633], but as [@Josh Mande said on Zulip|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236497486]:

{quote}
Based on our discussion in [#Security and Privacy|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236497486]  we needed to craft specific new "intermediate" LOA codes to capture the fact that most real-world id verifications don't reach IAL2.
{quote}

Our short-term need is to identify the canonical URI for this new code system, and verify that [these specific codes will be in the system|http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html]. This is to support the [SMART Health Cards: Vaccination & Testing Implementation Guide|http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/], which is currently being actively used by implementers.

items.newDisplayValue:
To support the SMART Health Cards: Vaccination & Testing Implementation Guide (http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/), we are requesting that "level of assurance" codes be added to a code system. Specifically, we would like the following codes representing identity assurance level, based on NIST 800-63-3:

* IAL1: Name and birth date were self-asserted.
* IAL1.2: An unspecified ID was used to verify name and birth date.
* IAL1.4: A US state-issued photo ID or nationally-issued photo ID was used to verify name and birth date.
* IAL2: Either remote or in-person identity proofing is required. IAL2 requires identifying attributes to have been verified in person or remotely using, at a minimum, the procedures given in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.
* IAL3: In-person identity proofing is required. Identifying attributes must be verified by an authorized CSP representative through examination of physical documentation as described in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.

This list of codes is copied from our IG: http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html.

These codes could be added to a new code system (if so we suggest http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa) or an existing code system (

To support the SMART Health Cards: Vaccination & Testing Implementation Guide (http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/), we are requesting that "level of assurance" codes be added to a code system. Specifically, we would like the following codes representing identity assurance level, based on NIST 800-63-3:

* IAL1: Name and birth date were self-asserted.
* IAL1.2: An unspecified ID was used to verify name and birth date.
* IAL1.4: A US state-issued photo ID or nationally-issued photo ID was used to verify name and birth date.
* IAL2: Either remote or in-person identity proofing is required. IAL2 requires identifying attributes to have been verified in person or remotely using, at a minimum, the procedures given in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.
* IAL3: In-person identity proofing is required. Identifying attributes must be verified by an authorized CSP representative through examination of physical documentation as described in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.

This list of codes is copied from our IG: http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html.

comments.body:
I agree adding a code to the HL7 managed codesystem is appropriate. (Adding a code to a codesystem managed by NIST would not be appropriate for us to do). But this is clearly a need driven code, and the current LOA codes are in an HL7 managed codesystem.

The LOA codes already exist in HL7 in this valueset [https://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet-v3-SecurityTrustObservationValue.html]
Thus your codesystem would be [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue]

so, just define a new code be added to the existing CodeSystem
comments.author: john_moehrke

comments.body:
Hi [~john_moehrke],

Can you please indicate which code in [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue] is equivalent to our {{IAL1}} code?

From what I can tell, codes like {{LOAAS1}} may be [authenticator assurance levels|https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#sec4] rather than [identity assurance levels|https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63a.html#sec4], though I'm not experienced with these terminologies so I could be missing something.

For example, this splits IAL and AAL: [https://github.com/TransparentHealth/healthcare-trustmark]

Thanks!
comments.author: masnick

comments.body: [~masnick], agree re: what you observe about authenticator vs. identity; that is likely due to 800-63-2 (and prior) combining identity assurance with authentication assurance into a level. I'm actually not seeing the 800-63-3 related codes in that table yet at all. It appears we may need to create not just the 1.2 and 1.4 but also 1, 2, and 3. And due to the split of NIST into IAL/AAL in 800-63-3 there would be different codes for identity and authentication assurance. So it seems the levels to add are IAL, IAL1, IAL1.2, IAL 1.4, IAL2, IAL3, and for those who might need them later (?) AAL, AAL1, AAL2, AAL3.
comments.author: juliemaas

comments.body:
[~juliemaas], thank you!

Can this be done in a separate code system like {{http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa}}? Using the {{v3-ObservationValue}} code system is not ideal for our use case as it may be confusing for implementers considering how many other unrelated codes are part of that.
comments.author: masnick

comments.body: That seems fine to me but [~lcmaas] has just suggested that what may also make sense is to either add codes to [https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2021May/codesystem-identity-assuranceLevel.html|https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2021May/valueset-identity-assuranceLevel.html] for the newer NIST levels and create an appropriate ValueSet of the new codes for this IG, or create a new, successor version of that CodeSystem specifically for 800-63-3-related codes as we're discussing. If a new CodeSystem is created, it might help if the new CodeSystem name was related to the old CodeSystem name so that it is more obviously a successor. Do you have a conformance liaison who can help guide what the Terminology group might prefer?
comments.author: juliemaas
masnick

comments.body:
I updated the Proposal Description above to be clearer about what we're asking for based on the discussion here. Below is the *original* version for easy reference:
{quote}We would like to create http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa to identify "level of assurance", which are codes representing identity assurance level, based on NIST 800-63-3.

These are the specific codes that should be in this system: http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html.

There are other LOA codes already a part of UTG: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236489633

But as Josh Mande said on Zulip (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236497486):

> Based on our discussion in #Security and Privacy (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236497486) we needed to craft specific new "intermediate" LOA codes to capture the fact that most real-world id verifications don't reach IAL2.


Our short-term need is to identify the canonical URI for this new code system, and verify that [these specific codes will be in the system (http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html). This is to support the SMART Health Cards: Vaccination & Testing Implementation Guide (http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/), which is currently being actively used by implementers.
{quote}
comments.author: masnick

comments.body:
Based on the discussion above, on Zulip, and on GitHub, I believe everyone is agreed on adding the following codes and descriptions:
|IAL1|Name and birth date were self-asserted.|
|IAL1.2|An unspecified ID was used to verify name and birth date.|
|IAL1.4|A US state-issued photo ID or nationally-issued photo ID was used to verify name and birth date.|
|IAL2|Either remote or in-person identity proofing is required. IAL2 requires identifying attributes to have been verified in person or remotely using, at a minimum, the procedures given in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.|
|IAL3|In-person identity proofing is required. Identifying attributes must be verified by an authorized CSP representative through examination of physical documentation as described in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.|

In terms of which code system they belong in, there appear to be two viable options mentioned above:
 # Create a new code system called {{[http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa]}}
 # Use {{[http://hl7.org/fhir/identity-assuranceLevel]}}

My only concern with using #2 is with the code system name in the URI: this mixes [kebab-case|https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/kebab_case] with [camelCase|https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/CamelCase#English], which will look like a typo to the software engineers who are implementing the IG. It also means that implementers will have to remember whether it's {{identity-assuranceLevel}}, {{identityAssurance-level}}, {{identity-assurance-Level}}, etc., which can lead to bugs. A cleaner name in the URI would be {{identity-assurance-level}} or {{identityAssuranceLevel}}.

The code system URI will appear without context in the JSON representation of our FHIR resources inside SMART Health Cards, and will likely be viewed by implementers (or patients!) without prior FHIR experience. So it's important to us from an implementer-friendliness perspective to have a URI that doesn't add friction or raise concerns.

If it's preferable to use {{[http://hl7.org/fhir/identity-assuranceLevel]}} rather than creating a new code system, is it possible to resolve the inconsistency in the name of the code system? (If not, it may be better to deprecate this code system in favor of one without the naming inconsistency, if that's possible.)

Thank you all!!
comments.author: masnick

comments.body:
To my point above about implementer/patient-friendliness to meet the needs of our use case, we discussed using [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue] for the code system above.

On further thought, this is not a good fit for our IG because 
{{{"code": "IAL1", "system": "}}{{[http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue]}}{{"}}} will not be understandable to anyone looking at the JSON. From a data modeling perspective, we would like the code system URI to clearly identify the content of the code.

From an implementer/patient-friendliness perspective, this URI does not promote understanding of the data and could even be alarming since the code system name implies IAL1 is an observation.

We are expecting a number of implementers who do not have prior FHIR experience to be working directly with the JSON resources described by this IG. It is better for them if the meaning of {{system}} is clear from the URI since software engineers typically expect names to be meaningful, especially in URIs.

We are also expecting that some patients will decode the contents of their SMART Health Cards themselves, and would like the value of {{system}} to not cause undue concern given the high level of scrutiny projects like SMART Health Cards receive.

For these reasons, v3-ObservationValue doesn't support our primary use case. We would like to proceed with one of the other options described in my previous post.
comments.author: masnick

comments.body: One more clarification: our initial suggestion of {{http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa}} is not optimal from a clarity perspective since "loa" could be anything. A more descriptive URI would probably be better  but keeping in mind we do have payload constraints so we would prefer to not be overly verbose :)
comments.author: masnick

comments.body: Checking back in on this...did the conversation continue elsewhere or are you still awaiting further input?
comments.author: juliemaas

comments.body: So you need to create a branch with the actual change, not just describe it in prose.   All of the affected objects need to be explicitly listed; no one is going to look them up for you.   We also need a Vocabulary Policy for removal of value sets, which we do not have.     We also have had in HL7 for many years a policy that code systems are not just removed; they are first deprecated then retired.   Just like concepts in a code system.   If these are reference in v2 then it also involved the v2 tables in question as well.  All objects must be identified,, enumerated, and 'removed' - which may be deleted from the source of truth and the manifests, but that should be decided on the Vocabulary call this week. [~Rob_McClure] a pretty fair amount of technical work to do on this before being able to submit it.
comments.author: tedhl7geek

Need codesystems/valuesets for:
- CPT Procedure Codes  (HCPCS I)
- CPT Procedure Code Modifiers  (HCPCS I modifiers)

CPT modifiers are available by subscription from the AMA at http://www.ama-assn.org/go/cpt. Copyright Statement: CPT copyright 2014 American Medical Association. All rights reserved.   

http://www.ama-assn.org/go/cpt
http://www.ama-assn.org/go/cpt-modifiers.

Initial use will be in CarinBB IG, but should see broad use.

Need HL7 US Realm CodeSystem/ValueSet for the following NUBC UB04 code systems:

1) Point of Origin
2) Type of Admission
3) Type of Bill
4) Revenue Code
5) Patient Discharge Status.  - does this already exist?  https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies-systems.html#http://www.nubc.org/patient-discharge

NUBC codes are owned, maintained and distributed by the National Uniform Billing Committee (NUBC). Use of NUBC codes require licenses. The NUBC link is www.nubc.org.

This is an industry standard code system used in claims processing.
Immediate need is for the Carin Blue Button IG 
This codesystem/valueset will be used by other payer-oriented IGs, so ideally would be defined at the HL7 level, and not within an IG.

issues.summary: Add ODH Code System content

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

comments.body:
Providing the full content (concepts with identifiers/codes, descriptions, properties, etc.) of a Code System in a FHIR CodeSystem resource published in HL7 Terminology requires a formal agreement between HL7 International and the owner of the code system's intellectual property to support the publication of its content by HL7. The AMA's SNODENT is one of the few examples of this in HL7 Terminology.

Further, it should be noted that by their nature code systems are always changing and publishing them in full comes with the responsibility to ensure they are maintained and up to date  formal agreements will stipulate this. Accordingly, while it may be straightforward to create a FHIR CodeSystem with all the ODH content, the risks of doing so.
(a) without a formal agreement; and 
(b) as a "one-off" which is not maintained on an ongoing basis
Should be understand and carefully considered.

The recommendation and I other members of the HL7 Terminology Authority (HTA) have to progress this is: That HL7 HQ work with Genevieve Luensman from the CDC to obtain a formal agreement (including conditions) to support publication of a complete FHIR CodeSystem for ODH. Once this formal agreement is in place, work can be progressed to develop the CodeSystem resource in accordance with the agreement and published in HL7 Terminology (as was done for SNODENT).
comments.author: reuben.daniels

customFieldValues.value: Currently the HL7 terminology contains only a stub  for the CDC NIOSH ODH code system. Implementation guides cannot effectively use concepts from this code systems and the workarounds lead to inconsistently. The best solution is to include the contents of ODH in the "external code system" and make it available to the tx.fhir.org term server to support FHIR IG dev. Based on our research this is only valid solution to avoid a lot of build error and workarounds (i.e. add the content through UTG to the FHIR IG term server).   VSAC is reluctant to publish content available in PHIN VADS and the PHIN VADS references to do not resolve to a

value: Realm Specific Vocabulary (US Realm for now)

issues.summary: Terminology package for STU3 contains incorrect URIs

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

customFieldValues.value:
All CodeSystem.url
CodeSystem.valueSet
ValueSet.url
ValueSet.compose.include.valueSet
ValueSet.compose.exclude.valueSet that mismatch the FHIR Core for STU3

All NamingSystem for STU3 should match their preferred uri so it matches STU3.

https://terminology.hl7.org/downloads.html

The R3?/STU3 download package contains system URIs that did not exist until FHIR R4. The UTG package should match the FHIR STU3 specification in this respect. Usage of the newer R4 system URIs in STU3 is not the implemented practice across the world. I cannot explain this in my realm when challenged with source of truth questions.

UTG did not exist when STU3 was published. I know that STU3 OIDs where truly wrong and I've made peace with that, but the system uris should not be 'retro-fixed' in UTG because they directly contradict implementations on STU3.

Example:
FHIR Core STU3 says 
    http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/AdministrativeGender
UTG says 
    http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-AdministrativeGender

value: Change of Preferred URI for existing resource(s)

comments.author: k.connor

customFieldValues.value:
11/18 Harmonization as implemented in DEFN=UV=VO=1451-20191215.coremif deprecated _ActConsentDirective.  The approved harmonization proposal moved
the following codes to _ActDecision: GRANTORCHOICE, IMPLIED, IMPLIEDD, NOCONSENT, OPTIN, OPTINr, OPTOUT, AND OPTOUTE.  EMRGONLY AND NOPP were approved to be moved to_ActGenericConsentDirecitve, but this was never implemented (I will create a separate ticket to implement these 2.)  But HTO imported an erroneous value set from FHIR, and these codes are all included in the deprecated _ActConsentDirective.  _ActDecision has not been included in HTO so there's no value set for it.  Please remove _ActConsentDirective and add _ActDecision under ActCode_ActPolicyType_ActConsent, so that an _ActDecision value set can be generated.

Then all of the codesafter that parent starting with _ActInformationActionPolicy to the end should be removed.

comments.body:
[~john_moehrke],

Somehow I managed to miss your '[~david_riddle] please submit this to [https://jira.hl7.org/projects/UP]' comment [here|https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-28218?focusedCommentId=178931&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-178931]. cc [~michelle.m.miller]

comments.author: david_riddle

customFieldValues.value: As described here (https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-28218?focusedCommentId=176728&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-176728), we have a use case that seems to stretch the current 'A device that operates independently of an author on custodian's algorithms for data extraction of existing information for purpose of generating a new artifact' definition of the Provenance participant type assembler code/concept (https://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem-provenance-participant-type.html).  We have an algorithm that derives CareTeams from multiple inputs and it includes business rules/intelligence that goes beyond simple extraction and mapping of existing information.  With that and this Zulip chat comment from @Moehrke,John in mind, I would like to propose that the definition of the assembler code be expanded to include language like...  'A device that operates independently of an author on custodian's algorithms for data extraction of existing information and/or application of business rules or intelligence to existing information to derive new information, for purpose of generating a new artifact'

issues.summary: Add Swedish policy rules to consent resource

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10

items.oldDisplayValue:
To support Sweden PDL requirements, we are developing a Patient Consent service. We have based the resource on the Consent resource in FHIR:

https://build.fhir.org/consent.html

In order to be compliant with Swedish law we need four concepts added to the consent resource:  inner block, outer block, case findings, and coherent journaling.

Here are the definitions:
Case finding consents are GDPR explicit consents. There is however a piece of PDL chapter 2, 3 that does this reference. So I propose we just reference PDL chapter 2, 3 for case finding consents. This is a data disclosure consent (opt-in)
Coherent journaling is a opt-in data access consent (approval to access data that has already been disclosed across entities. The disclosure itself does not require a GDPR consent - this is the contribution of PDL Coherent Journaling). This is PDL chapter 6, 3 
Outer blocks - this is a patients opt-out from coherent journaling with respect to data of a specific legal entity. A "block" (opt-out) excludes data from disclosure in the context of coherent journaling.  This is PDL chapter 6, 2 
Inner blocks - this is opt-out from access across clinical areas of responsibility (medically responsible care units) within a legal entity. PDL reference would be PDL chapter 4, 4.

PDL refers to PDL 2008:355. Here is a link to the document:  https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/patientdatalag-2008355_sfs-2008-355

We also have a zulip conversation here: 
https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179202-terminology/topic/Consent.20Category.20.5BSweden.20policy.20rules.5D

This is my first time posting.  If I need to modify what I have done or if there is more information needed, please let me know.

items.newDisplayValue: This issue is blocked by UPSM-10
Austin Kreisler, Brett Marquard, Lisa R. Nelson, Rick Geimer
Brian Pech, Frank Oemig, Robert Snelick
AbdulMalik Shakir, Austin Kreisler, Jean Duteau, Joel Francis
Grahame Grieve, Reuben Daniels, Robert Hausam

customFieldValues.value:
Add ActCode_ActPolicyType.SecurityPolicy_SecurityLaw 
Security Law (specializable )
Description:
A contractual, organizational or jurisdictional law, mandate, obligation, requirement, rule, or expectation that the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information is to be protected by management, operational, and technical safeguards (or countermeasures).
32CFRPart2002 (32 CFR Part 2002) (leaf concept) 
Description: The US regulation, titled "Controlled Unclassified Information" (CUI)  https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/CFR-2018-title32-vol6/pdf/CFR-2018-title32-vol6-part2002.pdf, established the executive branchs CUI Program, policy for designating, handling, and decontrolling information that qualifies as CUI, and the security mechanisms by which the confidentiality of CUI is enforced. This rule affects Federal executive branch agencies that handle CUI and all organizations (sources) that handle, possess, use, share, or receive CUIor which operate, use, or have access to Federal information and information systems on behalf of an agency. https://www.archives.gov/cui/about
SP800-53  (NIST SP 800-53) (leaf concept) 
Description: The publication, titled "Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations (Final Public Draft)", provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for federal information systems and organizations to protect organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation from a diverse set of threats and risks, including hostile attacks, natural disasters, structural failures, human errors, and privacy risks. The controls are flexible and customizable and implemented as part of an organization-wide process to manage risk. The controls address diverse requirements derived from mission and business needs, laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines. Finally, the consolidated catalog of controls addresses security and privacy from a functionality perspective (i.e., the strength of functions and mechanisms provided by the controls) and an assurance perspective (i.e., the measure of confidence in the security or privacy capability provided by the controls). Addressing both functionality and assurance ensures that information technology products and the information systems that rely on those products are sufficiently trustworthy. https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-53/rev-5/draft 
FISMA (FISMA) (leaf concept) 
Description: The US law, titled "Federal Information Security Modernization Act of 2014" (Pub.L. 113-283 https://www.congress.gov/113/plaws/publ283/PLAW-113publ283.pdf), requires each federal agency to develop, document, and implement an agency-wide program to provide information security for the information and systems that support the operations and assets of the agency, including those provided or managed by another agency, contractor, or other sources. 
FISMA, along with the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 and the Information Technology Management Reform Act of 1996 (Clinger-Cohen Act), explicitly emphasizes a risk-based policy for cost-effective security. 
Background: NIST has the statutory responsibility to develop tools and guidance for implementing FISMA, including an integrated Risk Management Framework which effectively brings together all of the FISMA-related security standards and guidance to promote the development of comprehensive and balanced information security programs by agencies. The Risk Management Framework provides a process that integrates security and risk management activities into the system development life cycle. The risk-based approach to security control selection and specification considers effectiveness, efficiency, and constraints due to applicable laws, directives, Executive Orders, policies, standards, or regulations.
https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/risk-management/detailed-overview
 SP800-171 (NIST SP 800-171 Rev. 2) (leaf concept) 
Description: The publication, titled "Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information in Nonfederal Systems and Organizations", provides agencies with recommended security requirements for protecting the confidentiality of CUI when the information is resident in nonfederal systems and organizations; when the nonfederal organization is not collecting or maintaining information on behalf of a federal agency or using or operating a system on behalf of an agency; and where there are no specific safeguarding requirements for protecting the confidentiality of CUI prescribed by the authorizing law, regulation, or governmentwide policy for the CUI category listed in the CUI Registry. The requirements apply to all components of nonfederal systems and organizations that process, store, and/or transmit CUI, or that provide protection for such components. The security requirements are intended for use by federal agencies in contractual vehicles or other agreements established between those agencies and nonfederal organizations. https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-171/rev-2/final
Unclassified Information", provides federal and nonfederal organizations with assessment procedures and a methodology that can be employed to conduct assessments of the CUI security requirements in NIST Special Publication 800-171, Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information in Nonfederal Systems and Organizations. The assessment procedures are flexible and can be customized to the needs of the organizations and the assessors conducting the assessments. Security assessments can be conducted as self-assessments; independent, third-party assessments; or government-sponsored assessments and can be applied with various degrees of rigor, based on customer-defined depth and coverage attributes. The findings and evidence produced during the security assessments can facilitate risk-based decisions by organizations related to the CUI requirements. https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-171a/final

issues.summary: Missing OID for BCP13
issues.description:
The URI scheme urn:ietf:bcp:13 points to Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Four

         HL7 OID Registry also has an OID 2.16.840.1.113883.5.79 for multi media types. Both appear to be about the exact same thing, but the OID has some weirdness which makes me uncertain:

         - ..5.n suggests it is an internal system. Expected is ..6.n

         - The OID points to part 1 of the same MIME stuff instead of part 4

         Request:

         Find out with the help of Ted Klein if the OID and the URI are actually the same. Align the meta data of the two so they do not seem dissimilar. Connect the dots in the FHIR terminology pages. If the OID and the URI are somehow not the same, create an OID.

issues.summary: non-unique designations on a concept
issues.description:
There are concepts defined in the v3-codesystems.xml file which have designations which are not uniquely identified by the attributes provided (language and value), which seems bad form to me, if you cannot uniquely refer to an element of a concept without evaluating nested attributes.

In examples like this, it seems that the id field of designation should be properly utilized to provide a way to distinguish individual designations.

Alternatively, the spec could be modified to allow more than one Use element to be attached to a designation, which seems like it would fit this use case better.

I can generate a list of all designations in the spec that have this issue, if desired.

 

For example:
{noformat}
*no* further _formatting_ is done here{noformat}
<CodeSystem> <id value="v3-AdministrativeGender"/>
   <concept>
     <code value="M"/>
     <display value="Male"/>
     <definition value="Male"/>
    <designation>
      <language value="nl"/>
      <use>
        <system value="http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/designation-usage"/>
        <code value="display"/>
      </use>
        <value value="Man"/>
      </designation>
      <designation>
        <language value="nl"/>
        <use>
          <system value="http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/designation-usage"/>
          <code value="definition"/>
        </use>
       <value value="Man"/>
     </designation>
   </concept>
